comment.author: 89996088@N00
comment._content: I think it's supposed to be John Haugen. It could fit with a Scandinavian name for a ski jumper (and Haugen is the Norwegian word for Hill) See this Feb. 22, 1913: John Haugen sets a new Canadian ski jump record at a jump on Connor’s Hill. Source: (search for John Haugen in the document) www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&ct=res&cd=... summary report.doc&ei=WEFsScz6JpiL-gb87amGDQ&usg=AFQjCNFsyClq7ayPRWgv_U0a2zLs19BAfA&sig2=8aJqP1crrrqTKdqr5IL65A My Google Search: www.google.com/search?rls=en&q=john+haugen+ski+jump+e...
